title: @meddler When is riot going to start talking about the Poppy update
body:
Aside from the brief, generalized explanation of her getting updated in that update thread and one of the devs saying on reddit that she's going to be a tank, riot really hasn't gone much into what's happening to the dwarfy yordle.  

For instance can we talk about any of these things:
1.  What's going on with her passive?  It seems like if she's going to be a tank, she'll need to keep it.
2.  Her Q?  This is a good anti-tank skill as well as her primary damage.  I'd hate to lose her TF-gunblade build.
3.  What's going on her with her W and E?
4.  We know she's losing her R, but that's going to be replaced with?
5.  Currently Poppy builds a lot of assassin items (people like that more on her) with one or two tank items.  Her gameplay feels like half-jax, half-Vi, neither of which are full tanks (Vi builds warriors and TF in most games, if she goes cinderhulk she'd probably replace warrior for a cleaver).  If anything, she feels like a dwarven fighter or beserker, someone who is a good mix of tank and damage.  Also she lacks a lot of reliable CC that a proper tank needs in LOL and to be honest that doesn't really fit her outside of the skill shot stun on her E.  

Right now, Poppy is a lategame champ who mostly ults, charges in, and beats people to a pulp with her hammer while probably chasing down and deleting the carry if necessary.  That's not really a tank.  So how can you guys justify making her a full tank and what is her core gameplay going to turn into?

We did test that out a little while back. Conclusion was that it took the E from a skill that generated a lot of interesting play for Poppy and her opponents around where everyone stood relative to terrain and changed it into a spell that just got used anywhere whenever Poppy wanted to jump on someone and stun them. More powerful and less interesting, which isn't a good combination.

What about giving Poppy some form of quicker repositioning? Condemn works on Vayne because she can quickly align her target between herself and a wall, but Heroic Charge currently doesn't work so well on Poppy because she lacks the tools to quickly get herself into the right spot (the movement speed buff on her W doesn't really work, either). On this topic, i have a few questions please.

1.  you say "it's safe to say that ult and passive will be replaced" can you please give us anything else? I don't want to sound like all the Poppy fans are broken records, but this is pretty the only information we ALWAYS get every single time we ask. Besides that, all we've ever been told, by [Morello](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3377668&page=6) himself is "if Poppy ever sees [high level] competetive play, she will be nerfed so hard she would be like the next Evelynn" and "a poppy rework is expected before season 5" Thankfully for the first and sadly for the second, so far these have not happened, but even any kind of update would be great, what are you struggling with? what ideas have you played around with? Is there some theme/ability that isn't working out?

2. In this [interview](http://www.newsoflegends.com/index.php/tag/poppy/#4), it's stated you're aiming to turn Poppy back into a tank, but what kind of tank? [Here](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/champion-update/dev-blog-champion-updates) It's said "Poppy looks like an armored and armed ball of golden death" Is it planned for her to be the mundo "be annoying with cleavers all day and just tank stuff forever" tank? Or more like VI, a tanky fighter, capable of diving into the enemy team/towers and wrecking someone. I guess the question is,  is the plan to take away all of Poppy's damage and leave her just as a tanky frontliner, or a fighter? Personally I would much rather see Poppy as a fighter than a straight tank, because, aside from her assassin qualities, towerdiving is one of the most notorious things Poppy is known for (and i don't just mean her ult) ant it feels like a shame

3. Please... please... please... I beg you all. If Poppy's E is the only thing that is going to be kept. Please put it back to a working order? Back in path 3.8. Poppy's Heroic charge was reworked to "better detect terrain" but now not only does it feel like it's gotten worse, It also seems to have the lowest priority out of any dash in the game. If her target a: dashes, b: dies, c: blinks d: sneezes too hard (riven) while Poppy is mid charge... she simply loses it and freezes mid movement. Every other targeted dash in the game at least continues on to the point where the target was (even if it's funny to see 2 Xin's switch place by dashing to each other) Poppy? just... freezes in place... loses a huge chunk of her mana and is kinda screwed. 8 seconds of immunity doesn't mean much if you can't catch anybody in that time. 


5. This is more of a personal request than a question, but one of my overall favorite things about Poppy is how she doesn't quite want to die when people think she's going to. Similar to how old Karma got stronger the lower her hp, or Trundle's amazing survivability with his ult+w, Poppy is very killable, and there are specific things like true damage, (I'm looking at you Darius... or ignite) that ignore her passive, but it always takes a bit more than most people expect. Some people may disagree with me here, but I believe that these things have been kept with both Karma and Trundle's reworks, and, even if it's in a different form than simply "take less damage the less hp she has" I would love to see that quality kept on Poppy as well.

Sorry this is a little long winded, but It's so rare Poppy players get any info at all. I keep trying to put her down because I don't want to get used to her all over again only to have her changed out from underneath me just when I was falling in love with her again, horrible early game and easy counter picks and all.

The mana problems are imposed in order to keep her from abusing people too badly with her hideously broken ult, by giving her a terrible laning phase.  Once they ditch the ult, there will be plenty of room to buff her in other ways, including mana costs.

No.  You'd just ult someone that your class counters their class, and they'd die without them *or* their team being able to do anything, and a lousy time would be had by all.  And then they'd have to nerf the character into nonviability because otherwise they'd turn fights into 5v4s (since you would still be around after the ult wore off, assuming it wasn't made to break instantly when one of the combatants dies).

That ult cannot be saved.

When you say her ult will be replaced, do you mean completely removed, or will her new ult be something similar to what is now? Because while I completely understand the need to remove her passive (as it is blatantly broken and isn't very interesting), her current ult is what defines her playstyle and is what many Poppy players love about her. To me it seems like getting rid of Acid Hunter or Mystic Shot or Riftwalk. Certainly you don't plan on making her an actual tank, do you?

I feel just the opposite: her ult is the really broken part of her kit and what is stopping the rest from being viable, her passive is a bit cryptic but could be reworked into something that does a similar thing more clearly (such as Poppy gains 1 armor and MR for every 2% of health she is missing, which would be kind of like the inverse of Olaf's passive, very appropriate IMO; or 3/4/5/6/7 for every 10% depending on level, if the flat version turns out to be too strong in early game).

Since you usually don't have her ult up, most of how she plays is how she plays when not ulting: building and maintaining W stacks, trading with E > Q and trying to position for the stun, being deceptively tough at low HP with her passive.  Toughness at low HP, if she keeps it, would also work well with Sterak's and Maw, which suggest more of a fighter identity than a true tank (but not really a juggernaut, since she has a gapcloser, something more Renekton-ish, except for her lack of true sustain and her personality).

I both agree and disagree with you here, they've said they want to keep Poppy's e, so I pray they fix it so it's not so unreliable.

for her R, i'd love to see poppy still able to towerdive, but the whole problem is she does too much damage with no items, also it's almost impossible to stop her. The other problem is, and this touches on the second point, Poppy is not supposed to be and adc/apc. she was supposed to be a tank. While i would like to see her still able to deal damage, Riot has already said "she will be turning into a tank" i think the most we can hope for is that she's more of a bruiser like Vi, able to be tanky and still kill a carry, which i think would still be fine. 

For Z, i think that's our w, it isn't required that every single champion have fancy mechanics, sometimes the simple 'run in and smash' character can be great too

the second point, like you said 'turning poppy into a tank would be like reworking talon as a tank' the issue again is, talon was supposed to be an assassin, poppy was supposed to be a tank, as much fun as it is to dive in and murder someone, it really doesn't fit thematically with poppy to be this invincible ball of death. I think the big issue here is, riot can either turn her into an assassin and kind of break the theme of her entirely, which they don't want to do, or rework her more into the tank she was intended to be, problem is, someone will be unhappy happy no matter which option they choose
